verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي الرَّجُلِ الْحُرِّ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ قَالَ تُشْتَرَى مِنْ مَالِ ابْنِهَا ثُمَّ تُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُوَرِّثُهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazal Bin Shazaan altogether, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Suleyman Bin Khalid, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> was saying regarding the free man who died and for him what a mother who was a slave. He said: ‘She should be bought from the wealth of her son, then emancipated (liberated), then she would inherit it’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجْرَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي رَجُلٍ تُوُفِّيَ وَ تَرَكَ مَالًا وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ قَالَ تُشْتَرَى أُمُّهُ وَ تُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُدْفَعُ إِلَيْهَا بَقِيَّةُ الْمَالِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Abu Najran, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying regarding a man who died and left wealth, and for him was a mother who was a slave. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘His mother should be bought and emancipated (with the son’s legacy) then the remainder of the wealth should be handed over to her’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا مَاتَ الرَّجُلُ وَ تَرَكَ أَبَاهُ وَ هُوَ مَمْلُوكٌ أَوْ أُمَّهُ وَ هِيَ مَمْلُوكَةٌ وَ الْمَيِّتُ حُرٌّ اشْتُرِيَ مِمَّا تَرَكَ أَبُوهُ أَوْ قَرَابَتُهُ وَ وَرِثَ مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الْمَالِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Ibn Bukeyr, from one of our companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When the man dies and leaves his father and he is a slave, or his mother and she is a slave, and the deceased is a free man, his father or his relatives be bought from what is left (the legacy), and they would inherit the remainder of the wealth’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الرَّجُلُ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ ابْنٌ مَمْلُوكٌ قَالَ يُشْتَرَى وَ يُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُدْفَعُ إِلَيْهِ مَا بَقِيَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Jameel Bin Darraj who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The man died, and for him was a son who was a slave’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should be bought and emancipated (liberated), then the remainder of what is left to be handed over to him’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي الرَّجُلِ الْحُرِّ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ قَالَ تُشْتَرَى مِنْ مَالِ ابْنِهَا ثُمَّ تُعْتَقُ ثُمَّ يُوَرِّثُهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Safwan, from Ibn Muskan, from Suleyman Bin Khalid, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> was saying regarding the free man who died, and for him was a mother who was a slave, he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She should be bought from the wealth of her son, then emancipated (liberated), then she would inherit it (the remainder)’.

verses.text:
عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ طَلْحَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ تَرَكَ مَالًا كَثِيراً وَ تَرَكَ أُمّاً مَمْلُوكَةً وَ أُخْتاً مَمْلُوكَةً قَالَ تُشْتَرَيَانِ مِنْ مَالِ الْمَيِّتِ ثُمَّ تُعْتَقَانِ وَ تُوَرَّثَانِ قُلْتُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ أَبَى أَهْلُ الْجَارِيَةِ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ قَالَ لَيْسَ لَهُمْ ذَلِكَ وَ يُقَوَّمَانِ قِيمَةَ عَدْلٍ ثُمَّ يُعْطَى مَا لَهُمْ عَلَى قَدْرِ الْقِيمَةِ 
قُلْتُ أَ رَأَيْتَ لَوْ أَنَّهُمَا اشْتُرِيَا ثُمَّ أُعْتِقَا ثُمَّ وَرِثَاهُ مِنْ بَعْدُ مَنْ كَانَ يَرِثُهُمَا قَالَ يَرِثُهُمَا مَوَالِي ابْنِهِمَا لِأَنَّهُمَا اشْتُرِيَا مِنْ مَالِ الِابْنِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Muhammad Bin Ja’far, from Abdullah Bin Talha, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about a man who died and left a lot of wealth, and left a mother who was a slave, and a sister who was a slave. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They should be bought from the wealth of the deceased, and they would both inherit (the remainder)’. I said, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view if the people (owner) of the slaves refuse, how should it be dealt with?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘That is not for them (to refuse), and they would both be evaluated with a just price, then they (masters) would be given what is for them in accordance with the price’. 
I said, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view if they are both bought, then emancipated (liberated), then inherit him, who would be the ones who would be inheriting the two of them afterwards?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They would both be inherited by the guardians of their son (the deceased) because they had both been bought from the wealth of the son’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَضَى أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ وَ لَهُ أُمٌّ مَمْلُوكَةٌ وَ لَهُ مَالٌ أَنْ تُشْتَرَى أُمُّهُ مِنْ مَالِهِ وَ تُدْفَعَ إِلَيْهَا بَقِيَّةُ الْمَالِ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ ذُو قَرَابَةٍ لَهُمْ سَهْمٌ فِي الْكِتَابِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> judged regarding the man who died and for him was a mother who was a slave, and for him was wealth that his mother should be bought from his wealth and the remainder be handed over to her when there do not happen to be any (other) relatives who have a (legislated) share in the Book (Quran)’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ أَبِي ثَابِتٍ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ مَاتَ مَوْلًى لِعَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ انْظُرُوا هَلْ تَجِدُونَ لَهُ وَارِثاً فَقِيلَ لَهُ إِنَّ لَهُ بِنْتَيْنِ بِالْيَمَامَةِ مَمْلُوكَتَيْنِ فَاشْتَرَاهُمَا مِنْ مَالِ الْمَيِّتِ ثُمَّ دَفَعَ إِلَيْهِمَا بَقِيَّةَ الْمَالِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazal Bin Shazaan, from Abu Sabit, from Hanan Bin Sudeyr, from Ibn Abu Yafour, from Is’haq Bin Ammar who said, 
‘A slave of Ali<sup>asws</sup> died, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Look around, do you find an inheritor for him?’ So it was said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘For him are two daughters at Al-Yamama, both slaves’. So he<sup>asws</sup> bought them both from the wealth of the deceased, then handed over to both of them the remainder of the wealth’.
